content.description:
Sit start with a small, left hand edge and a right hand jug.  Pull of the ground (crux), sort out the feet, hit a left hand sidepull, bump the right up and eventually hit the lip, and then top it out or cruise the lip left all the way to the boulder's apex.

Makes for a decent warmup.
content.protection: A pad should do, the landing is pretty good.
content.location:
It ascends the southwest arete of Daylight Boulder. It climbs just to the right of

Southern Sweet Tea

.

content.description:
Start on a small crimp rail and a smaller crimp for the right hand. Get high feet and move upward to a 3 finger sloper. From there, there is just one more move to the top with an easy topout.

This problem has potential for a sit start, but it would up the grade significantly.
content.protection: A pad or two and spotters. There's one smaller rock that might be of concern to folks.
content.location: The route starts in the center of the boulder with a stand start. The downclimb is just in back and is very obvious.

content.description:
Shadowcaster ascends a slightly overhanging arete on good rock over an equally good landing.

Sit start with an obvious pair of edges below the arete. From there, gain the horizontal rail, work the feet up, then make a big, awkward left hand move to a three-finger dimple/pinch (crux), match a right next to it on a spike, then work a few balanced moves on the remaining arete, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will do, the landing is slightly sloping, but very good overall.
content.location: It ascends the northwest arete of Daylight Boulder.

content.description:
This is a one move problem that climbs a near vertical face on good rock over a perfect landing.

Stand start with a left hand sidepull-pinch and a high right hand pinch-edge. From there, plant both feet on the wall, stick a right hand edge, follow to the lip, and make an easy mantle on top the boulder.

These short problems are very difficult to put a grade on. I can't tell if I am terrible at this move or if it actually has some difficulty.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Daylight.
